page.title: 07THE HEALTH CENTRE SWANAGE
page.content: There are 40 people working in the Swanage Health Centre. There are: 6 doctors, 8 receptionists, 2 nurses, 2 chiropodists, 3 health visitors, 5 district nurses, 1 midwife, 1 community health clerk, 4 community health nurses, 1 speech therapist, 1 social worker, 1 psychiatric nurse, 1 dentist, 1 dental nurse and 3 cleaners. The present building was built in 1982 and is made of red brick. There are 8,500 people in Swanage and if you include the surrounding villages the total population comes to 11,000. However in the summer this increases to over 50,000 and these people have to be catered for in the Centre. Pre-school children are injected at the Health Centre. These injections prevent: measles, polio, whooping cough and diptheria.
